For aggregated data, we opted for smoothed incidence rates (empirical Bayesian) because of the large variation of gross rates that would have strongly influenced the analyses. The number of people living in the neighborhoods of Salvador in 2015 was obtained from estimates according to the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), based on a 2010 census, and a linear interpolation was performed to estimate the population for the year 2016
